name: Kepler-275
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-275 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-275 is a star with 1.7899999999999991 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.38 times its radius. It is located 7029.31 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-275 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-275 b

Kepler-275 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.30 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-275.

The mass of Kepler-275 b is 7.42 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-275 b is 2.34 that of Earth. At 7.42 Earth masses, Kepler-275 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-275 c

Kepler-275 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.09 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-275.

The mass of Kepler-275 c is 17.95 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-275 c is 3.38 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-275 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-275 d

Kepler-275 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 35.68 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-275.

The mass of Kepler-275 d is 17.25 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-275 d is 3.33 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-275 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-275, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
